results.title: Cosmopolis
results.creator_credit: Lisa Ades, Ric Burns, New York Historical Society, Steeplechase Films, Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 5: Cosmopolis (1919-1931) examines the roaring twenties, a period when New York finished assembling the components of a mass consumer society and emerged as the cultural capital of the world. In this short but dazzling period, New York became the focal point of an extraordinary array of human and cultural energies, reaching its highest levels of urban excitement and glamour. This episode also considers the African-American experience and the rise of new media industries. The series concludes with the skyscraper war, the stock market rise, the Crash, and- in the deafening silence that followed- the building of the Empire State Building, the greatest icon on the New York skyline. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: Happy birthday
results.creator_credit: Jefferson Lewis, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. A young couple’s marriage is threatened over a decision as to whether the husband should accept a job researching poison gas for military purposes. The wife is adamantly opposed. Regardless of their decision, someone will take the job. Should one morally accept responsibility for the consequences?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jefferson Lewis, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Crow road
results.creator_credit: Calvin Miller, Bradley Adams, British Broadcasting Corporation and Union Pictures Productions
results.brief_description: Rory McHoan was last seen on his way to visit his brother, Kenneth, seven years ago. No trace of him was ever found despite an exhaustive police investigation. Inspired by his grandmother, Rory’s nephew, Prentice, takes on the task of finding Rory, and uncovering the truth about his missing uncle’s disappearance. With only Rory’s archaic and unreadable computer disks, pages of a novel-in-progress, and a ghost at his shoulders, Prentice must make a long journey with discoveries to be made about himself before he can unravel the dark secrets that lie buried in his family’s history. Based on a novel by Iain Banks. Cast includes: Joseph McFadden, Bill Paterson and Valerie Edmond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Calvin Miller, Bradley Adams, British Broadcasting Corporation and Union Pictures Productions

results.title: Who should decide?
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film deals with questions arising from advances in pre-natal diagnosis. Joanne, a victim of spina bifida, discovers that her unborn child has the same disease. A decision whether to terminate the pregnancy must be reached quickly. When her husband says that all he ever wanted was “a normal baby,” Joanne counters with “What is normal?”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: New York: a documentary film
results.creator_credit: Lisa Ades, Ric Burns, New York Historical Society, Steeplechase Films, Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: This five-part television documentary explores New York’s rich history as the premier laboratory of modern life. A sweeping narrative covering nearly 400 years and 400 square miles, it reveals a complex and dynamic city that has played an unparalled role in shaping the United States and reflecting its ideals. Two versions of the series are available: the original ten hour version originally broadcast in the US (NTSC) and the truncated 275 minute version broadcast in Australia. A comprehensive website based on the documentary can be found at http://www.pbs.org/wnet/newyork/

results.title: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit: Susan Huycke, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film looks at questions surrounding life-prolonging treatment for disabled newborns. When a teenage girl discovers that her newborn baby suffers from spina bifida and hydrocephalus, she refuses to agree to a life-saving shunt. While her boyfriend, the father, tries to convince her to accept responsibility for the infant, the hospital awaits their signed consent to proceed with the operation.
results.title_for_label: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan Huycke, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Courage of one's convictions
results.creator_credit: Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern technology. Because of her religious convictions, a seventeen-year-old girl refuses medical treatment that will prolong her life. Her decision remains firm in spite of the pleas of her physician, who begins to question who has the right to determine a person’s life or death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Old person's friend
results.creator_credit: Annie O'Donoghue, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. An elderly woman, bedridden and with a history of strokes, refuses medical attention and creates a dilemma for the hospital’s staff. Should she be allowed to die as she wishes or should everything possible be done to preserve life?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annie O’Donoghue, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Creative stitch
results.creator_credit: Jack Joynes and Creative Embroidery Association
results.brief_description: With so many techniques to explore, a wide variety of materials to be used and so many stitches to be devised, embroidery can be an expressive language. Ideas from nature and painting an be transferred to string embroidery, machine embroidery and other methods of needle weaving.
results.description: With so many techniques to explore, a wide variety of materials to be used and so many stitches to be devised, embroidery can be an expressive language. Ideas from nature and painting an be transferred to string embroidery, machine embroidery and other methods of needle weaving.
